summary:
Ambitious and hard-working financial analyst at the location technology software company TomTom. Achieved my MSc in Business Economics in 2018. Finalized the 2-year Finance Graduate program at TomTom Amsterdam in 2020 in which I have been rotating between the different departments in TomTom Finance. Hereby taking many different roles and responsibilities from being a business accountant to an internal controller.

Raised bilingual Dutch and British and having worked and studied in an international environment for the last 8 years, I have a profound multi-cultural experience. Both a team worker and individualist, very organised and eager to learn.

My background includes: Financial Analysis | SAP | Internal Control | Microsoft Excel | Financial Forecasting | Corporate Finance

school.name: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)

company.name: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)

certifications.name: First Year Certificate International Business and Management Studies

company.name: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)

profile_positions.description: After finalizing a 2-year Graduate programme in TomTom Finance, I now work full-time as a Financial Analyst in the Automotive Business Unit in TomTom.
profile_positions.title: Financial Analyst - Automotive

profile_positions.description:
The Internal Control (IC) team assists the​​ business in setting up an adequate internal control system. 

As part of the Graduate programme I will be spending my last rotation in both the Internal Control and the Internal Audit team as part of the Business Assurance department. This department serves the TomTom organization as a sparring partner that drives improvements in complex environments. The primary scope of the Internal Control department is to manage risk and increase the likelihood that established objectives and goals will be achieved which often have a technological component. Additionally, the department reviews the relevant governance and compliance-related matters.

Internal control & audit drives best practices in software development, data privacy and cybersecurity. Recommend improvements to the IT control environment as well as executing operational audits on processes as well as visiting our offices to do office reviews.
profile_positions.title: Internal Control Analyst

profile_positions.description:
TomTom Automotive provides navigation technology to global automotive manufacturers (OEMs) and Tier 1 suppliers.

Within the Automotive business unit I focused more heavily on financial analyst-related work from a more top-down approach. Actively participating in financial reporting and analysis of the Automotive department.
In these 9 months I have been continuously improving business reporting and been responsible for all North-American, Asian and Northern European revenue accounts which hold some of the biggest OEMs in the automotive industry. Next to this I also assisted the Automotive Bid team in creating the business cases for new deals wherein I work closely with the Automotive leadership team supporting global Sales & Marketing, Governance, and Pricing efforts. 

Some of my main tasks involved:
-  Working on detailed planning and creation of financial forecasts:  I have participated in three full forecasting cycles as well as the LTFM for 2020-2023.
-  Creating and improving monthly reporting to monitor financial and operational performance: actively using software tools such as BI and SAP analytics cloud.
-  Working closely with Financial Shared Service Center to ensure financial bookings are posted correctly and timely.
-  Completing detailed analysis on actual financial results vs. budget and forecasts and summarize it with concise and insightful commentary.
-  Provide financial point of view to assist leadership in decision making process around increasing automation and reduction of cycle time.
profile_positions.title: Financial Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Founded in 1991, TomTom is the world's leading provider of in-car location and navigation products and services focused on providing all drivers with the world's best navigation experience.
The two-year Graduate program at TomTom is about getting to know the various teams in TomTom Finance at which afterwards, I will continue in a guaranteed position in one of the teams in TomTom Finance.

In the first six months I supported the Business and General Accounting teams within the Financial Shared Services (FSSC). The Business Accounting team performs margin and subsidy activities in TomTom. My tasks involved:
- Compiling royalty reports based upon external royalty contracts and communicating these with TomTom vendors and customers;
- Preparing and maintaining royalty dashboards and overviews to ensure accurate accounting information.
- Manage preparation of quarterly audit schedules as required, working in cooperation with internal and external auditors;
- Participating in ad hoc projects to support management in increasing efficiency in the accounting processes.
- Analyze and review balance sheet and P&L positions and send out analytical reports and reconciliations out to the Business and Corporate Finance.

Within these teams I have intensively learned about all the technology created from the TomTom products and gained a bottom-up view of the company. This allowed me to see different aspects from beginning to end and brought new insights to my next rotation: TomTom Automotive.
profile_positions.title: Business Accountant

profile_positions.description:
The British recruitment agency Stanton House was established in 2010, with the goal in mind to improve and help the recruitment industry in making it more customer-focused.  Based in London, Stanton House also operates in Reading, Edinburgh and Hong Kong. Specialized in recruiting for mid to senior-level appointments in areas from Accounting and Finance to Change Management, Stanton House has an approach based on getting close to its customers so that they fully understand their requirements and can deliver the right solution.

As a finance intern I was responsible for processing interim’s time sheets and the invoicing of all clients. I maintained the credit control and the reconciliation of bank statements to keep track of cash flow. Lastly, I led company research in analysing and improving the firm’s cash flow as main part of my graduation thesis. With this I contributed to the creation of consultant training sessions in educating on cash flow efficiency.
profile_positions.title: Finance Intern

company.name: The British School in The Netherlands

profile_positions.company: The British School in The Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
The British School in The Netherlands (BSN) is a group of independent/private schools based in and around The Hague. An international school for girls and boys aged 3-18 which has a thriving community of 80+ nationalities. The BSN encourages high aspirations and challenges its students – supporting them as they learn and grow into confident individuals.  The BSN offers a British and international curriculum. BSN students go on to study in universities all over the world.
The BSN's blend of traditional British values, educational rigour, and caring and committed staff provides an environment for students to prepare for a happy and successful life, no matter the pursuit.

As a Marketing Intern I was responsible for updating and maintaining all social media networks as well as writing and publishing news articles concerning past school events aiming at international parents. Furthermore, I was responsible for managing all events by frequently maintaining and updating the school online calendar. As intern I created and led the BSN alumni community project through Facebook. Lastly, I was responsible for processing all new school applicants and frequently updating the school database on all BSN students.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: Educating children in high school about children of war through presentations.
Assisting in the sale of fair-trade products.
